characters: THE SOUND OF A CRYING BABY
THE CURTAIN COMES UP TO REVEAL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONE TOLL BOOTH ATTENDANT sits inside his glass box on an empty stretch of interstate. This is HENRY. He looks out at the horizon. It's starting to get light out. There's snow on the ground. He's neither asleep nor awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY'S PLASTIC GLOVES unscrew a THERMOS, pour coffee into a Styrofoam cup. There are only a few drops left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaches. Henry straightens, slides open his window. But the CAR veers over to the automated EZ-PASS LANE... Henry closes the window, watches the car disappear. He downs the last of his coffee, looks back out at the horizon again. It's cloudy out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: flips to 6:00.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry packs up his thermos, puts on his coat and steps out into the icy morning. He walks toward his truck. The traffic is beginning to build.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry's old FORD PICK-UP drives past the enormous, abandoned CENTRAL TRAIN TERMINAL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pick-up turns down toward a neighborhood of modest salt-box houses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry's truck rolls into his driveway. 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry enters. Hangs up his down jacket on a row of hooks. It's clean and ordinary in here. His wife, DEBBIE, is in the kitchen. She's wearing a NURSES uniform. Henry notices the dining room table set for one for breakfast. Eggs, bacon, sausage. He's a little surprised. Debbie appears. Lays down the toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down. He sits. She smiles. Starts buttering the toast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. Thanks. He digs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How was your night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. How was yours? She's still buttering the toast. Carefully.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. She sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is great. She sits down next to him. Watches him eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your shift's at eight thirty? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You not eating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already did. He takes another bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay? 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you coming with me to Cindy and Bill's on Saturday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. What time? Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the baby shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. She just stares at him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't want to go to Cindy and Bill's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean I want Cindy and Bill to come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy and Bill are welcome here anytime. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry. Isn't it time...isn't it time for us? Henry stops eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're talking about kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Okay' you want kids? Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love kids. He looks down, resumes eating. A beat. 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry? He looks up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you still love me? He's still as a stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I do. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I know you did once. A very long pause. Henry doesn't do anything now. She's crestfallen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened, Henry? He just sits.

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT DOORBELL RINGS
dialogues.text: Henry gets up, heads to the door. Debbie watches him go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside on the step there are TWO MEN in SOFTBALL UNIFORMS. One of them is puking. Behind them TWO more GUYS sit in the back of the car. Henry recognizes the smiling, pock-marked face of EDDIE VIBES. Two parts charm, one part menace. His puking friend is JOE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry Torne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie Vibes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how you doin', man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I got a man down here. 5.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie glances up and down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mind if we come in for a second?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie and Henry watch while Debbie attends to the sick JOE, bits of puke still clinging to his softball uniform. She touches his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's hot. He starts to retch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding it in) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better come with me. Eddie glances at Henry as Debbie leads him expertly toward the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamn sausage at Pinwheels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So we're in a little bind, Henry. Got league playoffs in a half-hour and Joe's our first baseman. And he's not exactly game-ready as you can see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Eddie stares at him. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I say what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel like playing a little ball? Filling in for Joe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's November. 6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. They keep the field in perfect shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you say? Henry looks around the room. For a moment he watches Debbie with Joe in the bathroom, the door half open. She's tending to him, caring for him... Debbie looks up. Sees Henry staring at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry drives. He wears Joe's too small softball uniform. Eddie rides shotgun, the other two in the back. They grimly stare out the windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appreciate you driving, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's this game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near Kaisertown. Like fifteen minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car turns a corner on to Main Street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull up right over here. We gotta grab some beer money at that ATM. The car pulls up to a row of stores including the FIRST BUFFALO BANK. Eddie pats Henry's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hang tight. We'll be right back. Eddie and the guys get out. Henry notes this is strange. 7.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment Henry realizes something stinks. He sniffs his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the rearview, Henry doesn't notice Eddie and the two guys slipping on SKI MASKS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PET STORE OWNER rolls up the security gates of his store and enters. He says good morning to all the animals. It's a strange one man show.

dialogues.speaker: LOUD ALARMS BLARE --
dialogues.text: Henry startles, looks back to where the sound's coming

dialogues.speaker: THREE GUYS IN SKI MASKS
dialogues.text: Fly out of the bank on the corner and scatter in various directions. They're all wearing softball uniforms. A BANK GUARD chases them. ON HENRY, confused. A second bank guard FRANK (50s, African-American) is crossing the street toward the bank with two coffees. He sees what's going on, drops the coffees, and pulls his gu

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You! Henry turns forward again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is pointing at him through the windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze! Henry slowly raises his hands off the wheel. Frank sucks his teeth, his gun trained on Henry as the distant sound of BLARING SIRENS grows louder. Holding on Henry's stunned expression...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry sits at a small table as a DETECTIVE, whose face we never see, paces back and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, we know this wasn't your deal. 8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry just listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you have to do is give me those names. And you can go home. It's that simple. Henry's still silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. Why are you sticking up for these people? They're not your friends. You've got a wife. You've got a job... don't you care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you have to do is say something. Henry looks up at him, making eye contact for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: JUDGE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...in light of the fact that this is a first offence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry stands in a suit, flanked by his state-appointed ATTORNEY. Debbie sits in the gallery. A JUDGE stares at Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the court sentences Henry Torne to four years in prison for the crime of Felony 1st Degree Armed Robbery.

dialogues.speaker: WHACK
dialogues.text: The gavel goes down. Henry blinks. He looks at his lawyer who is pleased with the sentence. He pats Henry, well done. Henry looks back at Debbie. She's just staring at him...

dialogues.speaker: CLANK
dialogues.text: A CELL DOOR is SLAMMED SHUT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, wearing a prison jumpsuit, watches as the guard locks the door in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: So. What're you in for? 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said what are you in for? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bank robbery. MAX (60s) pulls up his pants, flushes the TOILET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Clean. Simple. I like it. Henry just watches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I didn't do it. Max smiles. Goes to the sink. Washes his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Mistaken identity. A perennial favorite. Identities are just constructs, anyway. They're mistaken all the time. He dries his hands. Presents one of them to Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on. Make yourself at home. Henry sits down on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So...what are you in for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life. A beat. It's starting to hit Henry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you'll get used to it. 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the cell doors SLAM open. Henry startles awake. Max is already dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up. We gotta go. Henry's disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breakfast. A GUARD, seeing Henry still in his bunk, bangs his baton against the bars of the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Henry move along a line of convicts waiting for their food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Monday is whole wheat bun-day.' Henry's lost in thought...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you thinking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're thinking something. Let me guess. You're thinking, `How did I get here?' Henry puts out his tray.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think any of us got here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you how. Because we committed crimes. But we committed to the wrong thing. You see that was our mistake. We didn't fulfill our potential, we got angry and we took it out on other people. A bald, TATTOOED GANG-BANGER walks right past them to a t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See him? 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector. He wanted to be a doctor. He could've been, but he chose not to fulfil his potential, he chose not to commit to his dream. And now look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad choices, see. Henry does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, I recommend the potatoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Henry sit down at one of the long tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the real crime, Henry. Not committing to your dream. They begin to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure I ever had one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never had a dream? What kind of a life is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. A pretty good one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, you're in jail. Henry thinks about that. Puts a piece of potato in his mo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Henry walk through the crowded prison yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But here's the good news. We got all this time to do. And time is a medium of exchange. You can buy things with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knowledge. Self respect. Forgiveness. And in your case, you can figure out what your dream is. Max takes his arm :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dream is your truth is your destiny. Henry looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. I'm here by mistake. Max shoots a look back at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are no mistakes. Max suddenly glimpses some activity over Henry's shoulder

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Several convicts are making their way towards them... He pulls Henry close, his tone suddenly intense :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're going to have to fight for that dream, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're at a crossroads now. There are going to be tests!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What tests?

dialogues.speaker: CRAACK
dialogues.text: Henry's punched in the side of the head. The inmates grab him, throw him to the ground next to Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is your moment. Whatever you do now defines you. Go get em! Henry gets up : CHARGES the inmates, arms swinging, taking several down. He gives it everything he's got. They pile into him, pummeling him. Henry just keeps fighting...but it's hopeless. GUARDS rush in. Max watches. 13.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry lies on his bunk, his face battered and bruised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did good, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't feel good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're doing better than you feel. Henry touches his swollen eye. It stings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to sleep, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleep is for the blessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one we see lights blinking off across the vast string of cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry's wife Debbie sits at one of the metal visiting tables. She's dressed up. She's really made an effort. A door opens, Henry appears. He looks different. Some time has passed. He smiles, walks over. Then sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. You look beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. How are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay. How about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Henry. I have something I need to talk to you about. 14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fell in love. Henry takes that in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just...I mean it just happened. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Wow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not mad? He thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Henry. No one moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry sits on a bench alone, processing what just happened. He looks up at the sky. Gray and empty. Max arrives, sits down next to Henry, carefully puts a hand around his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ever tell you I was married? Henry turns to him. 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean nearly. I had a lovely correspondence going with Jocelyn Steinberg in Utica. Problem was when she finally came on visitor's day she said I was too short. Henry thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Books and covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Books and covers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's music on a radio. Pull back to reveal Henry sitting on his bunk. He's grown a beard. Their cell has temporarily been converted into a makeshift BARBERSHOP. CONVICTS of various races wait to get their hair cut by Max the Barber. Max holds up a mirror to his customer, FINK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean as a whistle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checking himself out) Max, I think you missed your calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do we got next, Henry? Henry checks the schedule by his side, calls out a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hector. You're up. Standing just outside, A GUARD watches the make-shift barbershop carefully. Hector takes his seat. Max wraps a sheet around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Max. When are you up for parole? 16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: October.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show us what you did for the board last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working. The other INMATES egg him on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Show us. Max finally puts his clippers down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, so I'm sitting there, and the head of the board asks me what I'm going to do if they let me out this time. And, so... Max's face starts to shudder...his shoulders jerking back a little bit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get this twitch! and then I give him my answer: "I'm gonna break in your house, set your dog on fire, eat all your food, go on a naked rampage through your garden, dance in the streets of your l'il hometown like a crazed harpee, hurl myself headlong flaming through the ethereal sky like God's blackest angel and explode like a goddamn heavenly fireball! Eyes ablaze and face beetroot red and twitching like a mad man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. You don't want ME. You don't want THIS. Not out THERE. The inmates look slightly scared. Max casually picks up his clippers and smiles :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe me, I'm not going anywhere. They crack up. A beat. 17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, White Shadow. When's your review coming up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna do the twitch like your cellie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you don't like it around here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone knows Henry's innocent. Laughter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The board don't like it when you deny the crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do the crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, but you got the time...so you may as well have done it. Everyone laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it! `You got the time, so you may as well have done the crime!' Everyone laughs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's funny, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're right. Henry ponders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INMATES shower. Alot of noise and steam. Henry and Max at the end of a row.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know you never did tell me what your dream was, Max. 18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm living it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure! It's easier to live in here. You don't have to do anything. You just show up. In fact they even do that for you. I'm living the life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This place is horrible, Max. Max thinks, lathering his hair...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why didn't you just say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back then. When you had the chance. When you were still innocent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought maybe this was my way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See. There are no mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's early morning. Henry's clean shaven, dressed in street clothes. He packs the last of his things into a sports bag, zips it up. Looks over at Max whose eyes are closed. Max looks vulnerable, like a child, the coverlet pulled right up to his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got everything, kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Henry, silent for a moment. 19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should think about getting out of here sometime. I'll buy you a cup of coffee on the outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing I've ever missed in twenty three years is a hot bath. And that ain't worth walking out of here for. The cell door slides open.

dialogues.speaker: PRISON GUARD, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Torne! Let's go! Henry starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget. Your dream is your myth is your truth. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought it was my dream is my truth is my destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just testing. Henry continues...stops at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well. I hope I never see you again. Henry smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still gonna miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cloudy. Henry walks through the front GATE of the prison. He takes a long deep breath of free air. It's cold. We see his exhale. He starts to walk. 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry sits in the back of the bus, the New York countryside streaking past him in a blur...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry turns onto his old street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry walks up to his doorway. He hesitates before ringing the bell. A beat. The door opens. It's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy who got sick several years before. He's wearing a suit and tie now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry. How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie! Henry's here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on in. Make yourself at home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry enters. His old house looks more or less the same. Joe heads over to small display of KITCHENWARE SAMPLES in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't mind me. I'm just getting set up for my meeting. You want a beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, do mind getting Henry a beer? 21.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Joe clips several FLOW CHARTS onto an easel -- they look like they were done by a kid -- Debbie appears with a Bud Lite. She hands it to Henry. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. It's not so awkward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie leads Henry to a NAVY BAG and a BOX with Henry's name on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's everything you wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. A beat. They just stand there for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you happy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad. He means it. Henry picks up the box, shoulders the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you going to do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know yet. Joe enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey, they're starting to arrive. Joe grabs a DISPLAY STAND featuring kitchen products.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're having a meeting. It's his new business. 22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, maybe you'd be interested, Henry. You could become a distributor for Jin Chi. They all head out of the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Korean kitchenware. The future of food storage. Plus, if you recruit distributors, you get paid even more. Passing through the living room arriving GUESTS notice Henry walking out carrying his box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean like a pyramid scheme?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! God, no. It's a multi-layered marketing paradigm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, why don't you give it some thought? Henry nods, starts to head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I just wanted to thank you. For not giving up my name. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know your name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you do. It's Joe. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. You're welcome Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you Deb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of yourself, Henry. He leaves. 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry walks down the street with his box. A NEIGHBOR approaches, recognizes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry! How are you? Henry looks over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm good. How are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. How was Greece?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greece?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie told us all about your trip. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Greece?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shitty apartment. Tiny. A bed. A desk. The TV is on low. Henry sits on a chair by the bed, the box between his legs, its contents spread out over the bed. Photographs of a long-forgotten vacation in Puerto Rico with Debbie. A Baseball glove. A high-school year book. Inside, a page of senior photos. He finds his own picture smiling at the thresh-hold of adulthood. Underneath his name it reads : "MOST NICEST

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He studies the image a moment, flips to the inner cover, graffitied with hand-written messages from classmates including : "Henry don't be such a fag, Eddie Vibes" Henry puts the yearbook back in the box. Next to it are a pile of photographs spread out...images from Henry's childhood...of him and Debbie...of different times. He finishes putting everything back. 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distinctive JINGLE! on the TV. Henry looks over. An ad for the local Buffalo lottery, a PRETTY YOUNG BLONDE in a sequinned dress speaks to the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a chance on life, take a chance on Buffalotto! Henry closes the lid of the box, regards it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry sits at a desk. He's handed a cup of coffee by his FEMALE PAROLE OFFICER -- whose face we never actually see.

dialogues.speaker: PAROLE OFFICER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (re: the coffee) Is it okay? Henry takes a sip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: PAROLE OFFICER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: So what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: PAROLE OFFICER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: About building your life from the ground up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Sounds good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grass field. It's raining. Henry steps into frame with a SHOVEL. Behind him an OLDER MAN in a cap pushes a wheelbarrow.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DITCH
dialogues.text: From a low-angle we watch as Henry digs. He's a few feet down. The wheelbarrowman still watches silently. 25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry lies on his bed, staring up at the ceiling. His mind turns. He's starting to think...O.S. the sound of the `BuffaLotto' jingle on the TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's snowing. The Wheelbarrowman watches silently as Henry digs another small ditch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry sits in the back row. We watch him as he eats popcorn. The movie flashes across his face. There are guns involved...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cloudy spring day. Henry climbs out of the ditch. Throws down his shovel and shakes the wheelbarrowman's hand. He walks away past ROWS OF GRAVES. He notices a flower poking through the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The female PAROLE OFFICER sets down a cup of coffee. Henry drinks. We still don't see her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. She sits down at her desk.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PAROLE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Seems like yesterday you walked through that door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PAROLE OFFICER
dialogues.text: Henry, You've done your time. You are now a free free man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does it feel? Henry takes a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She signs a document and hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PAROLE OFFICER
dialogues.text: So, What's next? Henry doesn't answer. The SOUND of boots, move in on HENRY'S EXPRESSION, staring, as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY'S DIRTY BOOTS march along the street with purpose... We follow them. After a while, the boots stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENRY looks up : we travel around him, see what he sees :

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST BUFFALO BANK
dialogues.text: Directly across the street. Holding on Henry as he contemplates the place... Henry takes a deep breath. Focuses in. There's something happening, he's not sure what it is...an idea perhaps, an instinct that somehow with each passing moment becomes more like a knowing.... A moment of revelation. He starts across the street toward the bank, moving now, heading right toward the front door, transfixed, as the SOUND DROPS out and he begins to smile --

dialogues.speaker: SCREEEECH
dialogues.text: A car HITS Henry in the side. He's knocked down. A GIRL (30s) Rushes out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? What the fuck are you doing? Are you okay? (into cell phone) Stan. I gotta call you back! I just ran someone over. No, he looks okay. 27.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You idiot, you weren't even looking where you were going! Are you okay? Henry's a little delirious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm okay. He grabs his thigh. Winces with pain. Tries to get up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Stay on the ground. The bank Guard FRANK rushes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he alright? Don't get up. I'll call an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't. (Starts to stand) I think I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Frank, confused) Is he alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just walked right out into the street. He came out of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the whole thing. You were on the phone. You weren't even paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I was. I know how to drive. Cars are honking now as Henry limps his way over to the sidewalk. 28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Get back on the ground!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Park your car. I'm going to take him into that cafe. She jumps back in her car and pulls it over to the side. Frank comes over to Henry, takes his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They let you out, huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get you a seat in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sets Henry down in a chair at one of the tables by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pierre! Une Verre d'eau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Julie comes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you call an ambulance? I'm calling an ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I really am fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's alright for a guy who just got run over. (sucks his teeth) Lucky I guess. Frank leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should call a doctor. Henry just stares at her. For a long moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Are you okay? He keeps staring... 29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, guy? Are you okay? Do you need a doctor? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. You look familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? It takes Julie a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. That.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Take a chance on life, take a chance on Buffa-lotto'? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's why. An awkward moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess you seem to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. So you're okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I can go now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And be more careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. 30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leaves. He watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else I can get you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bathroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hobbles down the hallway. He notices the photos on the wall. A series of HISTORICAL SHOTS of OLD BUFFALO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry peeing. His eyes drift to the photos on the wall to his right. He zeroes in on a prohibition-era newspaper framed FRONT PAGE. A photo of COPS IN TRENCH COATS posing in front of THE FIRST BUFFALO BANK WITH CRATES OF SEIZED BOOZE.

dialogues.speaker: ON HENRY'S FACE
dialogues.text: The sound of Henry's Pee STOPS. He takes a step closer to the next urinal over. Reads the rest of it... A COP IN A TUNNEL, smiling as he points up to a HOLE :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After a moment Henry starts peeing again. Thinking about what he's just read...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry comes out. Stares at the bank across the street. Looks both ways and then crosses the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry stands in the back alley behind the bank, feeling the place out...his head turns between the back door of the bank and the back of the building opposite...then looks down at his feet. He looks up again, notices the :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes over to it. It's locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry's still in his clothes, lying on his bed, his mind reeling, the TV on low.... He gets out of bed. Puts his foot in his boot.

dialogues.speaker: PRISON GUARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Max! You've got a visitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry sits at a visitor's table, waiting. A moment passes, a DOOR CLANKS open and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emerges with a guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I told you I didn't want to see your face again. Henry smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to see you too. He goes to hug him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No contact. They sit. They look at each other a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My destiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. What is it? A beat. Henry leans in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank is your destiny? 32.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one I didn't rob. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you went to jail for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about Henry? Henry looks around. Closer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did the time, I may as well have done the crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, that. Time. Crime. Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still don't get it. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To rob the bank. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in Jail. That's what I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got your review coming up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you can get of here. If you want to. 33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not as simple as that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm happy here. This is my home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a home. This is a prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you want to call it, I'm happy here. A beat. Henry looks at Max now. He looks frail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max. You can't die in this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can die wherever I want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really want to die here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm asking for your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To rob that bank?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've thought about it. It's the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For both of us. A long beat. Max gets up :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry. I got cards. 34.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great to see you, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max! Max exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry stares at the bank again...then walks down Mecca Road glimpses the marquee of `THE ORPHEUM' theatre. DAREK MILLODRAGOVIC's `THE CHERRY ORCHARD' by Anton

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry approaches, takes in the large photo of Darek and the PLAY POSTER, featuring a TREE, for the upcoming

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each `tree branch' of this poster dangles a small cherry- shaped PHOTO of the various ACTORS starring in it, including JULIE IVANOVA, the girl who ran Henry over, as Madame Ranevsky. A black and white American flag wrapped around the trunk of the cherry tree with bloody roots. Henry regards this with some interest, tries the theatre door. This one's open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry enters the lobby. The light is low. There's something almost magical about this place. Henry hears VOICES drifting in from the main theatre as he continues to walk, heading toward the sounds..

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: (As Madame Ranevsky) Is it really me sitting here? I want to dance and clap my hands!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry enters the back of the theatre...sees the girl on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl who hit him with her car. She's in mid-speech :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Madame Ranevsky) I think I must be dreaming. God Knows I love my country. I love it deeply. I couldn't see out the train window I was crying so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...I must drink my coffee...thank you Firs, thank you, you dear old man. I'm so glad to find you still alive. Henry's transfixed. She's good. ARNOLD, regional actor extraordinaire, plays Lophakin :

dialogues.speaker: ARNOLD AS LOPHAKIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Your brother Leonid Andreyevich says I'm an upstart. A Money grubber! (marching to and fro) He can say whatever he likes. I don't care a bit. He chews up the scenery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to believe in me like the old days. I just want your wonderful tender eyes to look at me like they did

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Stop! DAREK, the CZECH DIRECTOR -- greasy-haired, balding and smoking -- stands up in his seat in the stalls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too small, too safe! Stop showing me your `safe face' --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- But I was --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you. You're doing the best you can. You. He points to JULIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm...listening. 36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listening? You look like you're hearing. To hear is to be weak. To listen is to be strong. To listen is an action. Julie cocks her ear, mockingly. Darek marches up to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An action. I'm listening. Is this what you mean, Darek? Is this what you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Djula.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what do you want? They stare each other down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to be more. I want you to be better than that. He snatches the cup from her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now go drink coffee. And don't think about what I want, think about what you want!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I'll go drink coffee. Julie marches off stage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go drink coffee too! Let's all `go drink coffee'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes everyone! (to his Eastern European

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Olga! Coffee. Coffee for everyone. We'll all have coffee Djula! Every single one of us! And think about what we want!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watches as Julie comes up the aisle. She notices him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here? She doesn't wait, just walks right past... Henry follows. 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you here to sue me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw your picture outside. The door was open. I came in. She exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry catches up. She crosses the street, ignoring the traffic. Henry follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it always like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing back to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean rehearsal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekhov, right? They reach the Cafe. He opens the door for her :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were listening. She looks at him, curiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Henry by the way. 38.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They enter. It's busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Madame Julie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee, Pierre. She points at Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two. They stand right there at the bar. Silence. Henry notices the play poster on the wall over her shoulder. Looks at it. Then back at her. Comparing her photo to the live person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? She turns to see what he's looking at. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't look like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I meant the poster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. It's funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actors on a tree is funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She smiles. Pierre puts the coffees down on the bar. 39.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the director's joke. She starts dropping cubes of sugar in her cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's making a comment on the American culture. Actors faces as falling fruit. Birth, death, the consumption of the ID. Henry's interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To him, the American dream has become the world's nightmare. "You are the country of apocalypse."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what he told us on the first day of rehearsal, anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The irony is, he loves the American dream. I mean that's why he's here, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I know for a fact he hates himself for loving it. It's always an inside job, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the truth is I wasn't listening. I was playing it safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was right. The jerk. About that, anyway... She drinks her coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the Cherry Orchard was Chekhov's last play. He was dying when he wrote it. She thinks. He listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why? 40.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's my last play too. Here in Buffalo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're leaving? She downs the last of her coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right after we're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad you came by. Thanks for not suing me. I'll see ya. She leaves. He watches her through the glass as she walks across the street...right past the bank on her way back to the theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX's cell door opens. He walks, happy and confident this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Barber, tomorrow lunch, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give `em hell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always do, Felipe! As Max reaches the end of the walkway, an OLD GUARD opens the next steel door for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Max. Here we are again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your grandson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just started first grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's great. The socialization begins! The Guard smiles as he leads him toward the PAROLE BOARD ROOM at the end of another long corridor. They stop at the door. 41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many more of these you think you got in you, Max? Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As many as it takes. The Guard shakes his head, opens the door for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PAROLE BOARD OFFICER is reading Max's file as he enters

dialogues.speaker: HEAD PAROLE REVIEWER
dialogues.text: Good afternoon, Mr. Saltzman. Take a seat. The OFFICER gestures to the chair. The other members of the Board stare at Max. The head Parole officer leafs through page after page of denied applications. Max watches the pages turning, the years of his life going by, taking it in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Saltzman. Could you please tell the board why you believe we should grant you parole? They all wait for Max's answer. He's silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Mr. Saltzman, what have you got for us this time? Closer on Max. He looks like he might start to twitch at any moment....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (o.s.) Mr. Saltzman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gigantic PRISON GATES clank open. Max emerges, a tiny figure against the imposing facade. He's holding a small black valise. Looks like it was made in the 40s. 42.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks a little less sure of himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appears. Smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you could do it. Max looks around nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a car? What's wrong with you? You came to pick me up without a car. That's not picking a person up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. I'm here. I'm picking you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know about this. Maybe this is a mistake. Max turns....walks back towards the gates. Starts to POUND on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dave! Carl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, it's okay. You're free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up! DAVE! No response. Henry approaches. Takes Max's bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy. There's nothing to be frightened of. I promise. You're okay. The bus station's just a short walk. Max starts to hyperventilate : 43.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't breathe. I -- can't breathe... Henry hesitates a moment, puts an arm around him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to be alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nearly on his knees) I'm going to die right here. I told you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Max, we're going to miss that bus. Henry helps Max back up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GREYHOUND BUS rumbles through the countryside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Max sit up front right next to the driver. Max has his eyes closed. He still looks woozy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hungry? He opens his bag and pulls out a sandwich. Offers it to him. Max doesn't say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pastrami. On rye. A beat. Max opens one eye... A KEY GOING INTO A LOCK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry opens the door for Max. They enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we are. Henry indicates the tiny bed in the corner of the living room. There are some second hand books on the bedside table like `Future Shock' by Alvin Toffler and Dostoyevsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That one's yours. 44.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max goes over, looks at the books. Sits down on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else you need? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max reclines in the steaming TUB, luxuriating in the warm water. He closes his eyes, takes a deep breath, and relaxes. After a moment he notices a fancy-looking bottle on the s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reads the label) Ah. The land of milk and honey. Pours it into his bath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they cross a street, Max notices a coffee shop on the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this obsession with coffee, Henry? When did that happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure, Max. But it seems to give people a lot of purpose. They walk into the Cafe Orpheum.

dialogues.speaker: THE PROHIBITION-ERA PHOTO
dialogues.text: Henry looked at earlier when he was pissing. Max is staring at the thing now too...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Are you kidding? This was eighty years ago. It's ridiculous. Oh my God. That tunnel's probably not even there anymore! Are you dreaming, Henry? 45.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A start? This was your plan? An old cartoon in a pissoir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an article.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, Henry. Why don't we just go in with guns and do it the old-fashioned way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. No guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone could get hurt. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sweet, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the tunnel photo) Maybe it's still there, Max. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it is. Max looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Okay. Yes. First things first. Why don't we go take a look at this bank of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least we know that's still there. Henry looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Henry walk in to the grand banking hall. 46.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Money is a mistress with a hard heart.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK THE GUARD
dialogues.text: observes Max and Henry. Henry glances over at him too. Doesn't react. Frank watches them as they walk toward the CASHIER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to speak to your manager please. I'm interested in opening an account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NAME-PLACARD : `HOWARD TUTTLE, Assistant Manager'.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TUTTLE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: And which kind of account would you like to open?

dialogues.speaker: ON MAX AND HENRY
dialogues.text: Sitting in front of his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind do you have?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TUTTLE
dialogues.text: Savings. Interest only. Commercial --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know my uncle put all his money in that vault when I was a kid, after we came from Europe, before the war...the Brownshirts. He said that vault will be there for three hundred years!

dialogues.speaker: MR. TUTTLE
dialogues.text: We hope he's right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was never wrong. How long's it been there already Mr. Tuttle?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TUTTLE
dialogues.text: Since 1891.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in the very same spot, correct?

dialogues.speaker: MR. TUTTLE
dialogues.text: That's right. On the very same spot. 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, my boy!. History. It's all about history.

dialogues.speaker: MR. TUTTLE
dialogues.text: Now. As I was saying. We have savings. Interest only. Commercial --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll have to give us some time to think about which one. Max gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. You've been very helpful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Thank you. Henry and Max walk out past Frank. He watches them leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a nice day, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX AND HENRY stand in the alley. Henry touches the back of the bank wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The vault is here. He walks across the alley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tunnel runs under here... He follows it toward the back door of the theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And ends up somewhere in there. He turns to Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's virtually robbing itself! Henry laughs. THE DOOR HITS the back of his head as it SWINGS open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus...goddamn! Goddamn Czech Chekhov shit! 48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She storms out, punches the air, screams :

dialogues.speaker: AHHHH
dialogues.text: Suddenly notices Max and Henry standing there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rubbing his head) Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus. Henry? She looks at Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, Max. Max, Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, we were, you know --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just showing Henry the place I used to perform. Henry shoots Max a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. What? The door opens. SIMON, the Stage Manager, pokes his head

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's lunch, Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekov's tough stuff. It takes a steel stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Chekhov?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. Apart from Gorbachev he's my favorite Russian. She laughs. Max approaches her. 49.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you mind if we took a look around? It's been over thirty years since I've been inside. She considers the request.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. She gestures them inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Yeah. Come on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. As Henry passes :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. I'm in hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max walks to centre stage front like he's been there before. He looks out at the auditorium, a little emotional all of a sudden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Home again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what productions were you in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Shakespeare, Ibsen, Mahoney, the greats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the not-so-greats! Simon arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary wants to fit your wig at four. Darek says to stay hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it. Max and Henry exchange a glance. 50.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it be a tremendous imposition to have a little tour for old time's sake?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used to perform here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see why not. We're on a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That okay, Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Go ahead. Julie and Henry watch them go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that your dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He's a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He seems like your dad. Henry walks out onto the stage where Max was standing, getting the feel of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's peaceful out here. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretending to be other people. She thinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not really like that. I don't pretend to be someone else. I find some part of me, and reveal it in a new way...just inside of a character.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, in a way, you're still playing `you'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Exactly. In a way. 51.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what part of `you' are you playing now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the question you always have to ask yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max follows Simon through a tight hallway of DRESSING ROOMS. They pass ACTORS eating lunch or playing cards. Nothing very glamorous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, the inner sanctum. The magic before the magic! I remember it like it was yesterday. They enter the Green Room where ARNOLD is holding court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People often make the mistake in Chekhov of going down...but you must always always go up... Other ACTORS look at him with blank faces. Max gestures Simon closer. With a conspiratorial whisper

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simon, did you know there used to be a speakeasy down here during prohibition days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And they hid the booze in the bank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there was a tunnel too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forget. Where was it? 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry examines the fake bookshelves on the drawing room set. Julie sits in an armchair eating the sandwich she's pulled out of her bag. She watches him a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your story, Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, like...what do you do? Henry crosses the stage, goes to sit in the chair opposite her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm figuring that out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does that mean you don't have a job? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got out of jail. ON JULIE. She wasn't expecting that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jail!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds worse than it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Jail sounds bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why were you in there? She takes a big bite of her sandwich.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a murderer or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Do I look like one? She studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I look like? She studies him some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. A criminal. He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do? She laughs. Then stops. Dead serious :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A taped paper sign on the door reads `LOPHAKIN please knock'. Simon opens it for Max, shows him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got to be quick. Arnold doesn't like people in his dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A costume on hangers. A wig and beard in front of the mirror. Simon walks into the room. Places his hand on the far wal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was right here. Max comes up. Feels it now too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Booze, broads and lucre. The good old days. I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They filled it in, in 1931 when they built the theatre. Max pads the wall like it's a good old friend, testing it...searching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Times have changed. 54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All good things must come to... (he hits a hollow spot) ...an end. Max stops. Turns to Simon, and with a broad smile :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need volunteers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry picks up a marked-up text of the Cherry Orchard that's on one of the chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cherry Orchard. (leafing through it) So what happens? What's it about? Is it funny? Julie gets up out of her chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman returns to her family estate in the Russian countryside and realizes she has no choice but to sell her beloved Cherry Orchard, the magical place of her youth, the only place she ever felt safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it's not funny. She looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about being forced to let go of the past and create a new life in order to survive. Max's voice booms :

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: That was great! This place is full of treasures. Max comes right up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Julie. And thank you, Simon. I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max has very kindly offered to volunteer at the theatre! 55.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, let's get out of these people's way! Henry turns to Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing after rehearsal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like Chinese?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Golden Dragon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight o'clock?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. They look at each other as ACTORS return to the stage. DAREK moves towards his place in the front seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work. Work! It's time to work Americans!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even you Djula... Max grabs Henry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you, Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay out of jail. Henry waves. 56.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Henry exit the back stage doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right, Henry. You got a nose like a bloodhound!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You found it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Right there. In Lophakin's dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lophakin. We find a way to get into his dressing room and we're right as rain! Henry and Max notice FRANK standing at the corner of the alley having a cigarette. He glares at them as they pass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry gets ready for his date. Max keeps talking, sitting on the side of the tub as he draws the bath...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can see it, Henry. It's all in front of me. The vault. The bank. The tunnel. The pieces of the puzzle are on the table. All we got to do is put them in the right order!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing is the dirt...where does the dirt from the tunnel go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the vault?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First things first. I'm on the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had a good day, Kid. It's good to be back in the soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he starts to take off his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go have a nice supper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry places it between a PLATE and a NAPKIN, linking them together like...a tunnel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry waits for Julie. He's all cleaned up. Fresh shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late. I'm starving. She sits. Looks at the menu. A GUY who's leaving, sees he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bruce. The guy glances at Henry. Leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy's a total dick. Hi, Henry. She studies the menu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. How was rehearsal? She puts it down. No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel like duck.

dialogues.speaker: PLATES ARE CLEARED
dialogues.text: It's the end of the meal. Henry listens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't just want to be good, I want to be great. And I don't just want to be great in Buffalo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hollywood. 58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's where people go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want my legacy to be a Buffalotto commercial. And it's not going to be. Soon as this thing is done I'm out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like a plan. The waitress brings over the check and the fortune cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate fortune cookies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie sings along to the radio, smoking half a joint from the ashtray. Henry watches her. Julie knows she's being watched. She's enjoying herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We going anywhere in particular?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hits the joint) Want some? Henry shakes his head no. She turns the radio up.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY AND JULIE
dialogues.text: Walk along a precipice near some railings. They move closer to the ROAR. They look out at the flood-lit NIAGARA FALLS. Stand there a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know there's a whole bunch of bodies down there churning around. Just caught in the current.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all took the risk and look what happened to them. Same in death as they were in life. Imagine that. You kill yourself and nothing changes. 59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both stare down into the roaring water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those dreams churning around down there. It makes you sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get it. They start to walk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what did you do before jail, Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked at a toll booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rainbow bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had family that used to live on the other side. I took that bridge all the time. We must of met a hundred times! He nods. She's probably right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. So you were one of the guys in the tollbooth with those weird rubber gloves?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were watching everyone go somewhere and you were going nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Funny sad, not funny funny. 60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I worked nights. It gave me time to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About where I wasn't going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, that's funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about now? Where you going now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd they send you to jail for Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For trying to rob the First Buffalo Bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was on my way to a softball game. It was a mistake. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like it. He looks at her. Decides :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But now I'm going to rob it for real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to rob the bank you already went to jail for robbing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What tunnel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Runs from the bank to the theatre. 61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My theatre?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! She looks out the falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fucking hilarious, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. A beat. We can't tell what she's thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as the thought occurs) Ice cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry leans against the sink watching Julie at the table eating Ice Cream. There's music on in the b.g. They watch one another for a moment. She takes a big spoonful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I'm sitting here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither can I. She gets up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to dance and clap my hands. She moves through into the lounge. Henry follows. 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I must be dreaming! She starts moving around the room, dancing to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God knows I love my country. I love it deeply. She sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't see out the train window I was crying so much. Henry's not sure what she's talking about. She gestures to her copy of `THE CHERRY ORCHARD' on the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page twenty one. Henry opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't see out the train window I was crying so much. But I must drink my coffee.
