dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read Lophakin. She points to the right place. Henry, awkwardly :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `I have to go to Kharkov on the five o'clock train. Such a bother, I wanted to stay and look at you and talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're as wonderful as ever....' He stops, looks at her :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read the next line!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Even more beautiful, and dressed like a Parisian...you could blow me down.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say it like you feel it. Like it's real. Say it to me. Henry takes a beat. This time he makes it his. 63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even more beautiful, and dressed like a Parisian...you could blow me down.' She laughs like a little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good. Keep reading! And get up. Walk around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Your brother says I'm an upstart, a money-grubber.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you are. You're a bank robber, Henry! He laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (the text again) `I don't care a bit. I just want you to believe in me like the old days!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling him around the room) Don't stop --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `I just want your wonderful tender eyes to look at me like they did then.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again! Henry's getting into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `I just want your wonderful tender eyes to look at me like they did then.' She laughs some more. Comes closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm glad I ran you over. Henry puts the book down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too. They kiss... 64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Julie asleep in the bed. She opens her eyes. Realizes he's there with her...as if sensing her, he opens his eyes too. They look at one another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning. She climbs on top of him. Henry smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun streams in through the window. Tchaikovsky plays on a tiny transistor radio. Max humming to the music, reading `Future Shock' on the toilet. The sound of the front door of the apartment opening --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry!

dialogues.speaker: HENRY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling up his boxers) I figured it out! Once we're in that dressing room the dirt from the tunnel goes out through the roof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rushing out into the front

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bank doesn't stand a chance. HENRY is standing right there, holding a bag of groceries, JULIE is right next to him. Max goes white. He's in his underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah. Company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, Max. 65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max is frozen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. She knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't know the dirt from the tunnel goes out through the roof. She laughs a little. Max looks at Henry like `what the fuck?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We brought breakfast. How do you like your eggs? Henry enters the kitchen...leaving Max and Julie there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I'm not going to tell anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on. Max follows Henry into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry unpacks the groceries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About what we're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a crime. You're supposed to keep crimes a secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not kosher. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you like your bacon? 66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crispy. Max leaves the kitchen for the front room where Julie's waiting, amused by the whole thing. Max just stands there in his underwear a moment, sizing her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I'll get dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what were you in prison for, Max? Max slurps his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a confidence man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean a `con' man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never liked that word. It's only half of what it is. The word confidence comes from the latin. Fides. With Faith. Belief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm about. She considers this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you make people feel good...and then you rip them off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He glances at Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I was always much better at the feeling good part than the ripping off part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hence, the prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you guys worried about getting caught? 67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really. For me it's a win-win situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like jail. Three hots and a cot. Julie looks at Henry now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Henry? You like jail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I like it out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why would you take the risk? Is it the money? Henry doesn't answer, starts to collect the plates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It must be the money. Henry smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a criminal. A greedy little criminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (washing the plates) `Your brother Leonid says I'm an upstart, a money grubber...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...but I don't care a bit'. He turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `I just want you to believe in me like the old days.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Chekhov!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chekhov?! 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We read it last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really are good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were on a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reading Chekhov's a date? Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She downs her coffee. Stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to get to the theatre --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you give me a ride there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a volunteer! She regards him a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You weren't in any of those plays, were you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But can you give me a ride?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie as Madame Ranevsky. Her brother GAYEV and her daughter VARYA are also on stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All white! All White! Oh, my Cherry Orchard. After the dark, stormy autumn and the winter frosts you are young again and full of happiness; the heavenly angels have never abandoned you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, if only I could be free of the stone that weighs me down! If only I could forget my past!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching from the back of the theatre in the semi- darkness. He's transfixed. Max watches too. He wears his volunteer badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes and now the orchard will be sold to pay our debts, which seems impossible...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! It's mamma walking in the orchard...in a white dress! (laughing with joy) There she is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Momma, don't! A PROJECTION OF THE MOTHER FLOATS ACROSS THE SCREEN and dissolves into one of the Cherry Trees... Henry and Max speak in hushed voices :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is driving me crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could be digging right now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We could?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we were in that dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's rehearsal. There are people everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is pissing me off. Max leaves....after a moment he stops where he is...freezes... ...then turns back to Henry... 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be Lophakin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you did we'd be able to get into that tunnel whenever we want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not an actor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a bank robber either! And you're doing that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said you were a natural. That means you can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it does Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ARE Lophakin! A man who came from nothing. A man who's not afraid to create a new life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man who's in love with her! Henry stares at Julie, mid performance, on the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dream is your truth is your destiny! Henry thinks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't be Lophakin. They have a Lophakin. Max thinks... 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they didn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There has to be another way. Max, frustrated :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid, You forced me out of jail to help you. And I'm going to goddamn help you. But you got to help me help you. Now I need to know... (a fierce stare) ...do you want this bank or not? On Henry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I want it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you're gonna be Lophakin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walks down the street. It's snowing. He approaches the theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnold enters, shivering, shaking the snow off his coat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, everyone! None of the actors pay him much attention. He pours himself a cup of coffee, makes his way toward his dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnold opens the door with his key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnold enters, hangs up his coat. There is a FORMAL ENVELOPE leaning against his make-up mirror. He approaches. Opens it. Starts to read... 72.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he absorbs the words he lets out a small gasp.. and...falls into his chair. After a moment he puts down the letter and stares at himself in the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew this day would come. You deserve this, lubya. He closes his eyes. Bows his head. Starts to weep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON DAREK : the veins on the side of his forehead pulsate with rage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unprofessional shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Millodragovich --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie stands in the wings. Max joins her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnold's leaving the production.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. Gosh.

dialogues.speaker: DAREK AND ARNOLD
dialogues.text: on the stage. Simon behind them. Darek is right in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have no choice it's Willie Lohman we're talking about! (brandishing the letter) A Ken Waterstone production!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OOOH-LA-LA! A Ken Waterstone production. The heaven's have opened. You lucky boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run, run, to that pandering, populist, piece-of-shit-Waterstone and his spineless productions! You're perfect for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Darek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. Arnold marches off the stage with his case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone! I need a new Lopakhin. Now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm dying, Olga! Cigarettes! Cigarettes NOW! And COFFEE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll hold auditions this afternoon, Darek! I'll get the list -- Darek ingests caffeine and nicotine at an alarming rate :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen that shit-list! It's a disaster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I must think. He moves stage left past Julie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Djula! Your orchard cannot be felled before she has a chance to grow. And with that he disappears with Olga out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Ken Waterstone. She shoots him a look, picks up her stuff and goes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, on the phone, searches for her keys in the bag as she approaches her car. 74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Stan, yes! I know it's bullshit but that's what's happening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, he's `thinking'... She gets in the car. Tries to find a roach in the ashtray. A KNOCK at the passenger window. She looks up. It's MAX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? He gestures, `Can I come in?'. Max gets in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I can't give you a ride --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said he was a natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan. Let me call you back. (she hangs up, to Max) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry would be perfect for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Lophakin. It takes a moment till her mind gets a hold of the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Henry should play Lophakin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not even an actor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly. He'd be playing himself. (off her shocked look) Think about it Julie! He is Lophakin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man who came from nothing. A man who's not afraid to create a new life and put his past behind him. A man who's in love with you...Madame Ranevsky. A beat. She does think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I feel like the earth is suddenly shifting under my feet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fact is you need a Lophakin and Lophakin needs a dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you get him in to see Darek? She hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on here, Max? What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. She regards him. Suspiciously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made this happen, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes a good guy needs a less good guy to help the good guy be good. He smiles. A beat : She SLAPS him hard across the cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough. They just sit there for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He just needs a shot. One audition. Let the chips fall where they may.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it doesn't work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll get someone else. She thinks... 76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him a shot. One shot. That's all I'm asking, Julie. She thinks some more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, confidence man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie sits, looking at Henry who stands in the middle of the living room of Darek's apartment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Circles HENRY...walking around him...an animal tracking its pray...he's chain-smoking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you've never had any training...you've never been in a production...you don't even know the play...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read it. I think I know the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think. He glances at Julie. Then back at Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Your brother , Leonid Andrevich...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you perform Chekhov and not be able to say AND-REY-E-VICH! Now say it!

dialogues.speaker: ANDREYEVICH.
dialogues.text: Darek nods, continue :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother, Leonid ANDREYEVICH says I'm an upstart, a money grubber --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A money-grubber! 77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Convince her. Darek pushes Henry closer to Julie. She stands :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother, Leonid Andreyevich says I'm an upstart, a money grubber. He can say whatever he likes. I don't care a bit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into his ear) NEITHER DO I. Henry ignores him and with twice the passion --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to believe in me like in the old days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me, tell me. Darek laughs, circling... Henry takes her hand now...his voice drops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good God in Heaven. My father was one of your father's serfs, and your grandfather's serf before that. But you, you did so much for me in the old days that I've forgotten all that... His yearning is suddenly palpable. Intense. Tender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you...like a sister...more than a sister. Henry drops to his knees, supplicates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You piece of shit! Yes! Henry just breathes. He's unbreakable. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. 78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Darek considers him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tomorrow. Be more good. Henry and Julie share a look. He actually did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She drives. Henry rides shotgun. They both look at the road ahead. In silence. After a while...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this make me an accessory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things have certainly gotten a lot more interesting since you showed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean since you ran me over... She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make love. It's more intense than before. They climax. They lie there, breathless, looking at each other...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She makes tea. Henry sits at the table watching her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why are you robbing the bank, Henry? He doesn't answer. 79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not just about the money, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why are you doing it? It takes a moment for him to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to sit in that toll booth and think about just getting in one of those cars, going wherever they went. Just joining someone else's life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were asleep at the wheel. Henry smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was easier for me to go to jail than tell my wife the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I was going along with everything. I didn't know I could change it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now I'm changing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robbing the bank is changing it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It already has. She gets the honey out of the cupboard. Pours some in her tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was your wife like?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you're okay with this? I know it's a lot. She turns to him. 80.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for a girl like me, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darek addresses the full cast. Henry by his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Mr. Henry Smith. He will be taking over the role of Lophakin. If you please. He leads a light round of applause. Henry acknowledges

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Thank you. Looking forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top of act three. Twenty minutes. Olga, cigarettes! Henry walks briskly away. Julie watches him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry enters his dressing room, locking the door behind him. Max is already waiting. He turns the music on. They move the GIANT ARMOIRE that's against the wall aside. Max spreads a blanket on the floor to catch the falling rubble and holds another against the wall to muffle the sound. Henry pulls a sledgehammer out of a bag :

dialogues.speaker: WHACK
dialogues.text: He POUNDS the wall AGAIN and AGAIN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blanket is pulled aside to reveal MAX AND HENRY on the other side looking in. Max shines his flashlight

dialogues.speaker: THE EMPTY OLD TUNNEL BEYOND
dialogues.text: It's dusty. Max climbs through the hole, disappears down the tunnel. Henry follows, counting his steps... 81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Henry, stooped over, make their way down the dank, dark passage. Max's flashlight combs the floor. A glint of light now as something FLASHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracks! Trolley tracks! The beam scours the blackness ahead looking for the end....and there it is. A soot-covered WALL maybe ten feet ahead. They reach it. Henry touches the damp, decrepit brick, turns to Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's still twenty feet to go. He turns back to him :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to need another pair of hands.

dialogues.speaker: EXT.
dialogues.text: It's cold out. Max and Henry walk inside.

dialogues.speaker: INT.
dialogues.text: A giant screen showing the game. Henry and Max arrive at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: LOUD VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No! No! NO! You got to be kidding me! You suck! You SUCK! Could you possibly SUCK anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him? Henry and Max watch as JOE grabs his head, flops into a c Max looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Max sit with the guy -- JOE who's drunk. 82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for meeting us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Joe is looking worse for wear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's your pyramid scheme?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't a pyramid scheme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Joe hits his Schooner Longneck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It all fell apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were banking on that money, Henry. And now all I've got is a garage full of dumb Korean plastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kitchenware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what happens when a person tries to go `legit'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's killing me. Joe drains his beer. The WAITRESS arrives with a bucket of steaming wings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how's Debbie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's worried, Henry. The baby's due in a couple months. He grabs a wing. Rips off the meat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's pregnant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's pregnant. 83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry takes it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay if you want to punch me out. Tonight would be a good night. In fact I could use it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. This is great news. (off Joe's hopeless look) It's going to be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? It is? You know how much diapers cost? You know how much it costs to send a kid to college?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to send your baby to college? Joe keeps going on the wings. He's making a meal of it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course not. I'm just saying. The kid needs stuff. Stuff that's expensive. Stuff it deserves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These things are hot! I'm on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Joe, maybe we can help. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We might have a job for you. Max shoots a look at Henry. Joe chugs a glass of water, looking at both of them now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No foolin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, Max and Joe stand hunched over at the end of the tunnel. 84.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's maybe twenty feet till the bottom of that vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a lot of dirt, Henry. Max studies Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should get some guns and go get the money through the front door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No guns. People could get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about fake ones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're still guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen Joseph, guns are dangerous and we're not doing a simple hold-up. Tellers and tears and chump change. We're doing an old fashioned heist. We're going right into the belly of the beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in or are you in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Considering it... He picks up a shovel and CRUNCHES into the wall of dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope we don't get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Julie are in bed. He memorizes his lines. The TV's on low. Julie's Buffaloto commercial comes on. Julie snaps it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate that commercial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it. She looks at him. 85.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's your plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For when it's done. After. (making light of it) Am I going to see your picture in the post office or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But have you thought about what happens after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really, no. He thinks carefully before he says it :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Maybe I could meet you out west...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out west?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Maybe you could meet me there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did you think of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meeting me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I'm not going anywhere, Henry --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that was your plan. Do the play

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plans change, Henry. Okay? She gets out of bed. Throws on her robe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I ran out of maple syrup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow Henry as he walks through her apartment and finds Julie in the kitchen, standing at the sink, not moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a reason you didn't leave before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because life is fucked. It never works out the way you want it to. Silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Well. Maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you could still meet me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right! On the lam? You're dreaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just an idea. Why not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't going to work out, Henry. She turns to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't we both know that? On Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. Silence. 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should leave. Henry just stands there...stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry leaves Julie's apartment. There's snow on the ground. It's freezing out here. He starts to walk.

dialogues.speaker: MAX, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It's going to be incredible. I'm talking, Florida...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max hungrily munches his cheerios at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Palm trees. Sandy beaches. All you can eat sunshine. Grapefruits as big as your head! Henry sits across from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why couldn't I have met her after?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie. I asked her to meet me. After we're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah? What'd she say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She said no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course she said no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why of course?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because life ain't like that. There's always a cost. That's why they call it life. You got to pay somewhere. The piper must be paid to pipe. 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I paid already, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to leave her. Max looks at him. About to say something -- A KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll check. Henry walks to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is it?

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It's me. Joe. Henry opens it. JOE stands there. He's drunk. And a little sheepish. Now we see why : EDDIE VIBES is standing right beside him. He walks right on in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same bank. Shit, Henry. Now that's poetry! I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this guy? Eddie beams at Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your new partner. Max looks at Henry : `huh?'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in. Or you're out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I screwed up. Sorry, Max. Joe lies down on the floor. He's drunk as a skunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amused by the whole thing) Joe tells me you guys might need a little help with that vault. I know the whole story. 89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't dig. Dig?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got any cold ones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe doesn't know what he's talking about. He's a drunk. He made a mistake. Get out of that chair. Eddie laughs. Leans back on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, old man. Henry and I go way back. We've known each other since high school, isn't that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appreciate you keeping your mouth shut, Henry. One thing I admire in a man is the quality of loyalty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want, Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. Just the American dream.

dialogues.speaker: MAX AND HENRY
dialogues.text: At the window. Looking down as EDDIE gets into his car. He senses them watching him. Turns around. Gives them the thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Henry watch Eddie leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna kill him. With a knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slurred, on the floor) Yeah. You can't kill him, Max. He's got the vault --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Joe. 90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks over at Joe on the floor. Thinks about how easy it would be to just kick him in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb says we can't have sex till the kid's born. Says the kid'll know about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home. Please. Before it's too late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry in period costume. He has a beard. He watches from the stalls as they run a dress rehearsal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to be blunt, but, for God's sake, the man has robbed you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopping her ears) No! No! No! Don't say that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a scoundrel: everybody knows it but you. He's a petty scoundrel, a user... ON HENRY, feeling like the accused. From the stage Julie sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are twenty six or twenty seven, and you're still in the lower grades!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares? She locks eyes with Henry now :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ought to be grown up by now. At your age, you ought to understand about love --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you, Djula? Where?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with double the fire) You ought to love someone yourself! You ought to have an affair. Yes! Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. Good Djula! Scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carlotta and the girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's run the magic scene! Julie walks off the stage. She knows Henry is waiting for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to my senses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you should too. She walks on. He follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should talk about it. She turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to, Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry arrives to find Max attaching one of the bags of dirt to a pulley. Above them, Joe begins to hoist it up through the open skylight. Henry looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tugging the pulley) Three feet of it so far today. We'll make it. Henry goes to the open doors of the Armoire. The tunnel is deeper now and all lit up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, Max and Joe make their way toward Joe's car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think guys? If it's a boy do I cut him or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you know what they say, cleanliness is next to Godliness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say, Henry? Before he can answer : 92.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I see you guys in the bank. I see you guys in the alley next to the bank. They turn. FRANK, the bank guard, is standing right there. He's in his street clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I see you coming out of the theatre behind the bank. Frank sucks his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're up to Gentlemen. Henry, Max and Joe look at each other. Frank moves closer. Checks around to make sure no one can hear them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I want in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In on what? Frank snickers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't talk here. Let's drive. Max looks at Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe's driving. Max is in the passenger seat. Henry in the back next to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's on your mind, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The I.C.R.E. Indigenous Currency Retrieval and Exchange. They exchange glances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once a month a truck goes to all our partner banks across the border in Canada, picks up all the currency and brings it back home. They're listening... 93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd say on average eight to twelve million, held in our vault at First Buffalo for just a few hours before it's picked up for redistribution. Now they're paying attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a bunch of fools would rob that bank any other time. A beat. He leans closer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can give you that date. I can help with alarms. I can be your guy on the inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hypothetically say you were right about what we're up to...which you're not. But just say...why would you help us rob your bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got my reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This sounds like a set-up, man -- Frank grabs Joe. Glares into his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't fuck around, kid. I told you. I got my reasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, forgive us, Frank. But we're going to need to hear them. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wife got sick a few years ago. Insurance wouldn't pick up all the costs. So I went to the bank. They wouldn't help cover the difference. We were going to retire to the Loire valley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had to use all our savings to cover the bills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man gave it to you, huh. 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent everything we had -- then she died...thirty years I've been at that bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was her name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annie. Her name was Annie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Sorry. The moment just hangs there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: November 23rd. The money's delivered at eight and picked up at midnight. He turns to Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I retire in two weeks. This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You set up the table. I make sure dinner arrives hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAX and HENRY walk up to the theatre. They've got coffees. It's drizzling. They both look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. ON THE MARQUEE : "Chekhov's `The Cherry Orchard'...Opens NOVEMBER 23rd, 8 PM"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to have pull some nights. Henry thinks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should wait. Do it closing night. 95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't. He's retiring. This is a one time deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you there were going to be tests, Henry. Henry absorbs that. Looks at Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to leave her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AN AMBULANCE Peels into the drive. A PATIENT is wheeled inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking down a corridor toward a NURSE'S STATION at the far end. The doors open for him...he hesitates

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEBBIE in profile, smiling and talking to a seated receptionist who touches her very pregnant belly. Henry takes a step back, the doors close. He watches through the glass a moment... Debbie looks radiant. Peaceful. Happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walks back outside again. It's as if he got all the answers he needed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Joe are digging. Looks like they've been at it for hours - covered in dirt and sweat. Henry enters the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he is! 96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry picks up his shovel. Starts to dig. He goes at it hard. Max catches his mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Henry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. He turns to Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not leaving her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl -- He throws down his shovel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now listen, Henry. You're digging this tunnel. And you're gonna rob that bank. You're gonna take the money and you're gonna put it in the car and we're gonna drive away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is one thing. Julie is another thing. This is not that. That is not this. Understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! I think I got something... Joe furiously digs his shovel into the caked-in dirt above his head. Suddenly the ceiling of dirt comes free burying Joe who struggles to get out. Above, from where the dirt once was, is the smooth surface of concrete. The bottom of the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have arrived! Look at that. Joe gets to his feet - he looks dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry and Max are finished packing up the apartment. Henry looks out the window. A beautiful clear blue sky. 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a cloud in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So clear you can see tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good man, Henry. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You too, Max. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A line at the box office. THEATERGOERS mill around, waiting for friends or chatting, everyone anticipating a great evening of theatre.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cast, dressed for stage, is gathered in the green room, chatting nervously to one another.

dialogues.speaker: HENRY AND JULIE
dialogues.text: Standing on opposite sides of the room. Hush descends as DAREK walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this `American dream' of ours, everyone is happy and smiling, they have achieved their objectives...and yet in life there is only change, upheaval, the birth of the new...and that birth is painful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: avoiding Henry's gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our play is about misery, disconnection, a future that we don't see hitting us like a train...but tonight, my players, we show them...that this not a future to fear! He leaves. The players applaud --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the cushion in the corner ; double into the centre pocket! Everyone laughs. 98.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten minutes people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie sits by her vanity finishing her make-up. A knock on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in. Henry appears. She's surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to meet me in California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, we've been over this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're doing it tonight. She sits there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the only time we can get in the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course! Opening night. What else? Like I said, everything always fucks up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's fucked up. If it's tonight or a month from now, what's the difference? I still want you to meet me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing's fucked up? Have you looked around recently? You're leaving. What about the goddamn play?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arnold's coming back. Max arranged it already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure he did. He approaches her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want us to be together. She laughs. That's so ridiculous to her. 99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We screwed a couple of times, Henry! So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that's not true --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, really. A couple of times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you get it? I don't want to be with you. That cuts him dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a thief. Go rob your bank. A beat. He leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max helps seat some elderly people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enjoy the show, folks! He checks his watch...it's two minutes to eight. He walks briskly up the aisle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank watches through the glass doors out onto the empty street. He looks at his watch, sucks his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a headset. Points to Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtain! ON HENRY, watching the curtain start to rise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a long white post-modern room. Sounds of wind. It's may but frosty. 100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the windows. CHERRY TREES in full bloom which contrast with the stark modernity of the nursery set. They're BIG SCREEN projections on real tree trunks : LOPHAKIN enters with DUNYASHA, holding a candelabra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thank god the train is in. What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks his watch) Almost two. (blowing out the candle) It's light already. Henry yawns and stretches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The train's late. At least two hours.

dialogues.speaker: AN ARMORED BANK TRUCK
dialogues.text: Rounds a corner into view...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...pulls up right in front of the First Buffalo Bank. BERNIE and STAN jump out. Bernie knocks on the glass door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doin', Frank? He un-holsters his weapon, covers as Stan opens the back of the truck. Through the glass, Frank smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doin' good, Bernie. Real good. He sucks his teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max bursts out the back door of the theatre, his walk turning into a run...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie as Madame Ranevksy enters the nursery in rapt delight. 101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My nursery, my dear, beautiful, sweet nursery! This is where I used to sleep when I was a little girl! Henry as Lophakin turns to face her, waiting for her to say hello...instead she breezes past him.

dialogues.speaker: MADAME RANEVSKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm still like a little girl... She kisses Gayev and Varya and then Gayev again. She kisses everyone in fact, except Lophakin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your train was two hours late. How do you explain that? Is that good management?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie breaks the seal of an envelope, hands it to Stan. Frank unlocks the plastic casing to the VAULT KEYPAD for Stan who punches in the CODES on the slip of paper that was inside the envelope. Frank reaches into his pocket. We glimpse his phone. He presses `SEND'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max struggles to the top of a telephone pole by an open electrical box. His cell phone vibrates. He pulls it out, reads it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He unzips a fanny pack, pulls out a WIRE CUTTER, but his hands are trembling and he drops it... Thirty feet to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing next to Simon, Henry watches Julie perform from the side of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my childhood, my innocent childhood! I used to sleep in this nursery.

dialogues.speaker: MADAME RANEVSKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I looked out from here into the garden. I woke up happy every morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't she beautiful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. She looks out toward the window through which there is now a projection of the ORCHARD, this time in autumnal decay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my cherry orchard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Waiting...as he and Bernie watch Stan load the money into the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever think what you could do with all that money, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you'd do. Buy the Bills and put them in first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd need a lot more money than that. But I guarantee you I'd have them back in the Super Bowl within two seasons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. Another chance to lose. Frank laughs nervously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max picks up the wire cutters off the ground, checks his watch. His heart jumps. He starts up the pole again. Finally reaches the top. Struggles to find the right wire

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, oh god. Where are you, you little pischer? He finally finds the right one and CUTS IT : 103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bernie and Stan place the last of the money in the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're good. Bernie closes the vault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan returns to the keypad. Begins pecking in the re- arming code --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AS Max quickly attaches the CIRCUIT BYPASS WIRE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan completes the code. Just as he's about to hit the `Enter' button --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max CLIPS the bypass onto the other side of the wire and the NUMBERS START TO COME UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stan hits `enter' -- the vault CLANKS again. Locked. A RED LIGHT indicates the alarm is on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max looks at the screen. ALL THE NUMBERS MATCH. The red light turns GREEN. He sighs, relieved.

dialogues.speaker: LOPHAKIN, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I saw this excellent piece of theatre yesterday. Really very funny. 104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure it wasn't in the least funny. I believe people like you should examine their own lives instead of going to the theatre to observe other peoples!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True enough. To be honest. We live a stupid life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Stan and Bernie are by the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well this is it, Frank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got you something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little retirement gift. Bernie produces a neatly wrapped gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Open it. Frank does. It's a bag of coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We wanted to get you something from France.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like French Roast, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know this isn't from France.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? It's French roast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. But over there they call it coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slightly baffled, at Bernie) But this is French roast... 105.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe and Eddie in the tunnel, waiting. Eddie looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? Where's that old man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max pulls open the door, sweating, runs inside... straight into Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie -- Break a leg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play's already started, Max. She walks past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye confidence man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good-bye, Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max hurries down the stairs, rushes into Henry's dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max opens the armoire, looks inside to a waiting Joe and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About time, old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do your job. Joe leans over and pukes on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! Not again! What is it with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a pussy, Joe, you know that? Eddie grabs the drill. Starts to make a hole. Joe starts to prepare the charges...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lophakin and Madame Ranevsky perform.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what should we do? Tell us what to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tell you every day. Every day I say the same thing over and over. You must rent out the Cherry Orchard and the rest of the Estate for villas. At once, right this second, the auction is coming up very soon -- A muffled BOOM (o.s.) Henry freezes. Julie looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all so vulgar! Another muffled BOOM (o.s.) this time the audience looks around. Julie glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry rushes in to the tunnel to find Joe and Max staring at the underside of the steel bank vault. It's like a gleaming jewel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was good, kid. Good acting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little giddy) There she is. Henry reaches up, touches the steel vault bottom, rubs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of there! Eddie arrives in his protection suit, holding a thermite burning tool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shit comes straight from hell. 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They scramble out. He puts his protective helmet on. Lights it. It's like an inferno

dialogues.speaker: WHITE HEAT AND SPARKS
dialogues.text: EDDIE's manic face behind the mask, a man possessed, screaming, a river of molten steel dripping down right in front of him. KRUUUNK! The bottom of the vault drops onto the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke clears to reveal EDDIE. He pulls off his hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to my world, bitches. They all look up at THE HOLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as his head rises into view through the newly cut hole. He climbs in and touches the saran-wrapped STACK OF CASH, subdivided into bricks. He sits on it. Thinking... It's dead quiet in here. Max pops his head up. Stares at the cash :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on, Henry!

dialogues.speaker: MADAME RANEVSKY, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Is the cherry orchard sold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audience's POV as Madame Ranevsky faces Lophakin on the other side of the stage. It's like a showdown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who bought it? Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did. Madame Ranevsky is overwhelmed by the news. Varya takes her keys and throws them on the floor. Exits in a rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought it. Wait a minute ; don't rush me. I'm all dizzy. I can't talk...

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, JOE AND MAX
dialogues.text: Stuff duffel bags full of cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deb's gonna freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lophakin swirls on stage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and now the Cherry Orchard is mine. Mine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God! God in heaven. The Cherry Orchard is mine! Tell me I'm drunk, tell me I'm out of my mind, tell me I'm dreaming!

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE, JOE AND MAX
dialogues.text: Finish lining up the duffels of cash by the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, it is. Max freezes, suddenly notices Eddie is standing there with A GUN pointed at him and Joe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that, Eddie? 109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a gun, Max. Max doesn't seem so surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with the gun) Joe! Take the money out back to my car. Joe doesn't move. Eddie waves the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe! Max boldly steps right in front of the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay right where you are, Joe. Eddie puts the gun to Max's stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid, Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to do this, Eddie. Eddie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can shoot me dead if you want, but you're going to have to shoot me dead. Eddie PUNCHES Max in the gut, then pops him in the head as he throws him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not playing with you, old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Eddie? The door swings open -- HENRY -- walks in on the scene...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the party, Brando. Seeing the gun, Henry freezes at the door. Eddie's in the middle, Max and Joe by the mouth of the tunnel, Max on the floor, a gash on his forehead from Eddie's blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, Eddie? Eddie turns at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's money, Henry. Money. 110.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was your chance you idiot. You could've been a better man but you did it again. You messed up. And now you're back with the maggots. Just one big missed opportunity. Eddie kicks him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Come on, Eddie. We're here. We're done. He's right. Come on, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Joe. Get the money. Put it in the car. Shut up. He turns back to Henry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now move, Torne. No happy ending for you. He gestures to the tunnel. Joe suddenly turns back, grabs Eddie's gun hand from behind. THE GUN GOES OFF. They wrestle. Joe bites Eddie's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You animal! Max, straddling Eddie, grabs his head, bangs it on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Famach deh mohl! Gey lig mitt'n vahntzin son of a bitch! Henry, a little dazed, picks up the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the extension chord. He does. They roll Eddie over, start to hog tie his hands then his legs. Eddie starts to freak out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't have done this without me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our new partner. Huh. Max stuffs a glove into Eddie's mouth but Eddie still kicks like crazy. Max notices Henry's thigh. 111.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ok? Henry sees it now too. It's a graze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got shot. Henry hears the tannoy. It's his cue. He's late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get on stage. He rushes out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On stage, the lights come up revealing a LINE OF HOODED FACELESS FIGURES standing behind the scrim, axes by their side. They walk out onto the stage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, my friends, thank you. Lophakin rushes on stage. He's late. Yasha, holding a tray with small tumblers of champagne, shoots him a look. Madame Ranevsky enters from the other side, hands out cash to the line of hooded figures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The peasants have come to say good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're good fellows, Yermolai Aleksayovich but in my opinion a little stupid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Madame Ranevsky) You gave them everything in your purse, Lyuba. Wrong, quite wrong!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I couldn't help it. I couldn't help it. Gayev and Madame Ranevsky walk past Lophakin, ignoring him on their way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still a little out of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't you please come here and drink a glass as a good-bye? 112.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie, gagged and bound, lies in the middle of the tunnel as Max closes the door to the dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old man, huh. Eddie tries to scream but he can't. As Max shuts the door all light is blotted out.

dialogues.speaker: THE PEASANTS/HOODED FIGURES
dialogues.text: positioned now by the cherry trees behind the scrim and back-lit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going and not a soul will be here until after we're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until spring. She notices he's clutching his thigh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Joe load the last of the duffels filled with cash into the back of Joe's car... They get inside. Joe starts the engine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any minute now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye, home! Goodbye to the old life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello to the new life! Trofimov exits with Anya. Varya looks around the room and exits. Yasha and Carlotta exit with the dog. Lophakin to Madame Ranevsky and Gayev :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until the spring, then. Goodbye my friends, until we meet again! 113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he and Julie exchange a final look. She watches him go...it's as if he's moving in slow motion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister! My sister!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my dear, sweet, lovely orchard! My life, my youth, my happiness, farewell! Farewell!

dialogues.speaker: ANYA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Mamma!

dialogues.speaker: TROFIMOV, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Aa-oo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry comes out the back door. Gets in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the leg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's fine. Go. Joe guns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sitting in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Peasants/hooded figures raise their axes. They suddenly have the manner of executioners... They stand ready to fell Madame Ranevsky's beloved orchard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Madame Ranevsky) One last look at these walls, these windows...Dear mother used to love to walk about in this room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister! My sister!

dialogues.speaker: ANYA, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Mamma! 114.

dialogues.speaker: TROFIMOV, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Aa-oo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Madame Ranevsky) We're coming. The sound of the HOODED FIGURES as they chop the trees behind her. It's horrific. Madame Ranevsky holds her hands over her ears and falls to the ground...and begins to weep...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, stop the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't stop the car, it's the getaway!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you can't --

dialogues.speaker: STOP THE FUCKING CAR
dialogues.text: Joe screeches to a halt. Henry gets out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing? Henry starts to run back toward the theatre as best he can... Max sticks his head out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry! But he's already gone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HOODED FIGURES finish destroying the orchard. TREES litter the stage... Madame Ranevsky still holds her hands over her ears on the ground... 115.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the cacophony ends, she gets up slowly and turns to walk off the stage...

dialogues.speaker: RIGHT IN FRONT OF HER
dialogues.text: Coming down the aisle is HENRY as LOPHAKIN Pause. He comes closer. He's limping slightly....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to come back. I couldn't get on the train. The moment I stepped on the platform, the blood drained from my heart. ON JULIE, in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew I might never see you again. He steps up on the stage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is he doing? Why is Lophakin back?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry, what is this? What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the only way you'll listen to me. She looks out to the audience. EAGER FACES awaiting Madame Ranevsky's response...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should have gotten on that stupid train. You made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The mistake would have been getting on that train without telling you how I feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ha! Don't pretend you care about me. All you care about is money. 116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to get past him. He blocks her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is about money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. He grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's never been about money. You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it! Just leave, Henry! (under her breath) Get off the fucking stage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a chance. Meet me in Moscow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm perfectly happy here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true. Meet me in Moscow. She tries to get away again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just afraid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not afraid of anything -- She kicks out at him.

dialogues.speaker: MADAME RANEVSKY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What am I afraid of Henry? Tell me! 117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're afraid because I love you. That hits her. Pause. She breaks away from him, stepping back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the side of the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...what? She searches his expression now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet me in Moscow. She can't move. The audience is rapt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me you'll meet me in Moscow. There are tears in her eyes now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go with him!

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER AUDIENCE MEMBER
dialogues.text: Meet him in Moscow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at the back of the theatre. Stunned :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He loves her.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE AND HENRY
dialogues.text: She whispers softly. Looks down at his leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Henry. You're bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK
dialogues.text: Darek is alive once more... 118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whisper to Simon) Lights down ten. Down ten more. Slowly... Julie and Henry in silhouette now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck, Henry... The lights fade, as an image of WHITE CHERRY BLOSSOMS appears on the projection screen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...which become REAL BLOSSOMS on a CHERRY TREE, widening to reveal an orchard, the most beautiful you've ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: A STONE FARM HOUSE
dialogues.text: Frank sits at a table outside in the garden. He pours himself a Pernod. He looks happy as a clam. A CAT jumps in his lap, purring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello miou-miou. He looks out at the lush valley below. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A state of the art hospital room. No expense has been spared. A shaky image of DEB's face as JOE frames the video camera. THE BABY comes into view now. It's beautiful. And screaming its little lungs out.

dialogues.speaker: JOE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: It's a girl!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A girl. 119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NURSE hands the baby to Debbie. Joe looks on, tears stream down his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We follow A MAILMAN past a row of palm trees as he enters a traditional-looking BARBER SHOP : "MAX'S - A PLACE FOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mailman hands a few letters to the pretty front desk GIRL. Max, his back to us, finishes a shave, talking his customer's ear off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is a medium of exchange. You can buy things with it. Education. Self-respect. You can even figure out your dream. The Guy nods. Max turns. We see him now. He's super tan. He pulls the sheet off his client.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're done. Next! Another YOUNG CUSTOMER sits down. There's a few of them waiting their turn, enjoying Max's schtick. The front desk girl hands Max the mail. CLOSE ON A POSTCARD : `Our dream is our truth is our destiny...Love H... xx' Max smiles. Flips over the postcard and only now when he pins it above the mirror do we finally see what it is -- an image of THE HOLLYWOOD SIGN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me, Javier. What's your dream?

dialogues.speaker: THE SOUND OF BREATHING
dialogues.text: Fade up on : what looks like the AFRICAN BUSH. It's hot. There are insects buzzing around and it doesn't look like rain's landed anywhere near here in years. A HAND reaches out for another HAND, helping someone over the final step.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL HENRY AND JULIE
dialogues.text: Sitting right below the Hollywood sign now... 120.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking down on the whole basin of Los Angeles. She hands him a bottle of water. He drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. You can see the ocean. He puts his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Your brother says I'm an upstart, a money grubber...but I don't care a bit.' She laughs...they kiss in the sun for a while...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDDIE VIBES is being questioned by the unseen DETECTIVE.

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: I'm only going to ask you one more time, Eddie. Who was it? Who helped you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you before. Dopey. Sleepy. Happy and Doc -- WHAACK! The slap knocks Eddie to the ground. He's under the table now, his face crushed by the Detective's BOOT :

dialogues.speaker: DETECTIVE, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: You know what you are Vibes? A liar, a cheat, a thief and a loser. He presses his boot down harder ON EDDIE'S FACE :

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may be all those things but one thing I'm not...is a rat. Eddie smiles. His face squashed sideways like that, it's a pretty strange kind of smile...
